III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to: (ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 9/30/24, a staff member and youth had a verbal exchange that
escalated to a physical altercation. Youth was standing against
the wall and staff member pulled the youth forward and put him in
a wrestling move which turned into a chokehold. Another staff
member arrived and twisted the youth's arm around his back.
Youth lost consciousness for 10 seconds as a result. A third staff
came on scene and the youth was dragged across the floor into
his room. Staff member slapped the youth across the face and
straddled youth's chest with knees pressed to the youth inner
biceps. Youth got up and staff body slammed youth into the
cement platform of the bed. Youth has discoloration on the chest
and biceps as a result of the incident.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 10/14/2024 by phone.
Complainant stated Central Intake was called after meeting with
Youth A and discussing his 09/30/2024 grievance about being
physically assaulted by youths, additional allegation of improper
restraint by Staff 1 and witnessing Youth A with a black eye,
bruised foot and swollen lip.
Youth A was interviewed on 10/10/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention Center with another DHHS worker. Youth A
stated during morning shift on 09/30/2024 he requested and
received a pen from Staff 1 to write a letter. Youth A stated Youth
C threatened to hit him for refusing to return the pen to Staff 1.
Youth A stated Staff 1 grabbed and choked him in the classroom
until his vision went blurry and then dark. Youth A stated he “woke
up” to Staff 1, Supervisor Trainee and Supervisor 1 carrying him to
his room (room 2) and pulling down his pants in the process.
Youth A stated he could not describe the details, but Staff 1,
Supervisor 1 and Supervisor Trainee were on top of him when
2

they physically managed him in his room. Youth A stated Staff 1
bent his right thumb back and hit him while Supervisor 1 and
Supervisor Trainee yelled at Staff 1 to stop. Youth A stated when
Staff 1, Supervisor 1 and Supervisor Trainee left his room and
closed the door, he ripped his shirt and tried to choke himself with
it. Youth A stated Staff 1 entered his room and slapped him twice
in the face when he took the shirt away from Youth A as
Supervisor 1 and Supervisor Trainee told Staff 1 to stop. Youth A
stated he then flooded the toilet when he was locked again in his
room. Youth A stated Staff 1 entered his room and said, “I don’t
care what they say. I’m gonna do what I’m gonna do” and
“slammed” Youth A’s head on the desk, “slammed” Youth A on to
the bed on his stomach and placed his knees on Youth A’s body.
Youth A stated Director of Residential Life (DRL) came to the unit
and placed handcuffs and ankle shackles on him before
transporting Youth A to room 9. Youth A stated Supervisor 1 later
removed the handcuffs and shackles from Youth A.
Youth B was interviewed on 10/10/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention Center with another DHHS worker. Youth B
stated Youth A jokingly threatened to stab Youth C with a pen in
the classroom. Youth B stated Staff 1 physically managed Youth A
and took Youth A to room 2 with Supervisor Trainee’s assistance.
Youth B stated Staff 1 put Youth A in a headlock and Youth A
began to cry and spit at Staff 1. Youth B stated he heard Youth A
say, “You hit me. I’m pressing charges.” Youth B stated he does
not know if the comment was directed at Staff 1 or Supervisor
Trainee. Youth B stated Youth A banged his head on his room
door when staff left his room. Youth B stated Supervisor Trainee
went into Youth A’s room and told him to stop banging his head
and then hit Youth A on the head. Youth B stated Supervisor 1
called Supervisor Trainee’s name three times and pulled
Supervisor Trainee away from Youth A. Youth B stated Staff 1
physically managed Youth A until DRL and Director of Operations
(DO) arrived on the unit and spoke with Youth A about his flooded
room. Youth B stated Youth A was placed in handcuffs and ankle
shackles by DRL and moved to room 9.
Youth C was interviewed on 10/23/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention Center with another DHHS worker. Youth C
stated Youth A threatened to stab him with a pen after throwing a
box of colored pencils at him in the classroom. Youth C stated he
does not know how Youth C obtained the pen. Youth C stated
Staff 1 asked Youth A to turn in the pen and Youth A refused by
not moving or saying anything. Youth C stated Staff 1 grabbed
Youth A after Youth A spit on him. Youth C stated Supervisor 1
3

and Supervisor Trainee entered the classroom and assisted Staff
1 in transporting Youth A to room 2. Youth C stated Youth A tried
to choke himself using a blanket in his room. Youth C stated Staff
1 entered Youth A’s room and “slammed” Youth A on to the bed.
Youth C stated Youth A swung back and hit Staff 1’s face and
Supervisor Trainee grabbed Staff 1 away from Youth A. Youth C
stated staff left Youth A in his room with the door closed. Youth C
stated Youth A papered the window on his room door, flooded his
room and was transported to room 9.
Youth D was interviewed on 10/23/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention Center with another DHHS worker. Youth D
stated he was in the classroom sitting at the teacher’s desk when
Youth A and Youth C began to argue. Youth D stated Youth A had
a pen or pencil in his hand and threatened Youth C. Youth D
stated Youth A refused to give the writing instrument to Staff 1 and
Staff 1 tried to grab it from Youth A. Youth D stated Supervisor 1
and Supervisor Trainee came to the classroom and one of them
directed Youth A be placed in his room when Youth A began to
spit and not follow verbal redirection to calm down. Youth D stated
Youth A was physically managed in the classroom for punching,
kicking and spitting at Staff 1, Supervisor 1 and Supervisor
Trainee. Youth D stated Youth A then threatened to kill himself
and staff cleared Youth A’s room of his belongings before placing
Youth A in his room. Youth D stated Youth A flooded his room and
staff turned the water off to Youth A’s room. Youth D stated Youth
A was later moved to room 9 in handcuffs.
Youth E was interviewed on 10/23/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS worker. Youth E stated his
name is “John Doe” and did not acknowledge his given name.
Youth E stated he does not know Youth A.
Youth F was interviewed on 10/23/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS worker. Youth F stated he
did not witness the incident involving Youth A in the classroom or
Youth A’s transport from the classroom to room 2. Youth F stated
Staff 1, Staff 2, Supervisor 1, Supervisor Trainee, DRL and DO
walked Youth A in handcuffs and ankle shackles from room 2 to
room 9 after Youth A flooded room 2. Youth F stated Youth A was
angry and used profanity during this transport.
Youth G was interviewed on 10/23/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS worker. Youth G stated he
knows Youth A but was on the intake unit and not on Unit 3D on
09/30/2024.
4

Teacher was interviewed on 10/30/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS worker. Teacher stated
Youth A has a “short fuse” and was in the classroom verbally
going back and forth with Youth C. Teacher stated Youth A either
had or picked up a pen in the classroom and threatened to stab
Youth C. Teacher stated a male staff was present in the
classroom and intervened by redirecting and standing between
Youth A and Youth C. Teacher stated he packed up his materials
and exited Unit 3D for his next class. Teacher stated he was not
present when Youth A was physically managed. Teacher stated
teachers are trained in Handle with Care, but do not typically
participate in physical management.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 10/16/2024 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with his Union Representative 1 and another DHHS
worker. Staff 1 stated Youth A refused to give him the pen and
said, “I’m gonna stab someone.” Staff 1 stated he reached for the
pen in Youth A’s hand and they fell to the ground. Staff 1 stated
he redirected Youth A to calm down and give him the pen. Staff 1
stated Youth A responded by trying to bite Staff 1 in the chest and
spitting on Staff 1. Staff 1 stated he put Youth A in a “headlock” to
move Youth A’s mouth away from his chest. Staff 1 stated Staff 2
redirected the other youths in the classroom to back away. Staff 1
stated he “knocked” the pen out of Youth A’s hand and Supervisor
1 assisted him in escorting Youth A to his room. Staff 1 stated
Youth A struggled and kicked during the transport and once in
Youth A’s room, Youth A wrapped his arms around Staff 1 and
began to spit and then swung on Staff 1. Staff 1 stated Youth A
sat on the ground and tried to bang his head against the bed. Staff
1 stated he held Youth A’s head (one hand behind Youth A’s head
and the other hand on Youth A’s forehead) and told Youth A to
relax and not hurt himself. Staff 1 stated Supervisor Trainee was
also in Youth A’s room and verbally redirected Youth A to not
follow them out of the room. Staff 1 stated Youth A banged his
head on his room door when he and Supervisor Trainee left and
closed the room door. Staff 1 stated he checked on Youth A and
found Youth A’ s room flooded with his underwear in the toilet.
Staff 1 stated Youth A also ripped his shirt and placed it around
his neck. Staff 1 stated he entered Youth A’s room with Supervisor
Trainee and Youth A wrapped his arms around Staff 1’s legs and
spit at Staff 1 while Staff 1 pushed Youth A’s arms in an attempt to
remove himself from Youth A’s hold. Staff 1 stated Nurse and
assistance were called and they came to the unit. Staff 1 stated
Youth A was placed in handcuffs and ankle shackles and taken to
room 9. Staff 1 denied Youth A losing consciousness, being
5

straddled by staff or having his arm twisted behind his back on
09/30/2024. Staff 1 denied being directed by another staff or
supervisor to leave the classroom or room 2 to help de-escalate
Youth A.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 10/16/2024 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with her Union Representative 1 and another DHHS
worker. Staff 2 stated she was in the classroom with Teacher and
several youths when Youth A threatened to stab Youth C with a
pen. Staff 2 stated she notified Staff 1 and Staff 1 tried to retrieve
the pen from Youth A. Staff 2 stated Staff 1 and Youth A began to
tussle for the pen and they went to the ground. Staff 2 stated she
tried to assist and get Youth A off the ground. Staff 2 stated she
witnessed Staff 1 with one arm across Youth A’s collarbone below
his neck when he held Youth A on the ground. Staff 2 stated she
did not witness Youth A lose consciousness. Staff 2 stated
Supervisor 1 and Supervisor Trainee came to the unit and
directed Staff 2 to open Youth A’s room door to prepare for Youth
A’s escort to his room. Staff 2 stated she did not witness how
Youth A was transported from the classroom to his room because
she was taking items out of Youth A’s room for suicide precaution.
Staff 2 stated Youth A was placed in his room and began to cover
his room door window with wet papers. Staff 2 stated Staff 1
opened Youth A’s room door to remove the papers to maintain
line of sight. Staff 2 stated Youth A then wrapped a ripped shirt
around his neck and Staff 1 retrieved the shirt causing Youth A to
spit at and become “combative” with Staff 1. Staff 2 stated
Supervisor 1 and Supervisor Trainee entered Youth A’s room to
assist Staff 1. Staff 2 stated Staff 1 held Youth A back from exiting
his room as Supervisor 1 and Supervisor Trainee left the room.
Staff 2 stated shortly after Staff 1 exited Youth A’s room and
closed the door, Youth A flooded his room. Staff 2 stated
Supervisor 1, Supervisor Trainee, DRL and Therapist came on the
unit. Staff 2 stated DRL redirected Youth A to stop putting his
hands on staff, directed handcuffs and ankle shackles be placed
on Youth A and directed Youth A’s transport to room 9. Staff 2
stated she did not witness Youth A’s transport because she was
occupied in cleaning up the flood water from Youth A’s room.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed on 10/16/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with his Union Representative 2 and another
DHHS worker. Supervisor 1 stated he responded to an assistance
call when Youth A tried to stab two youths with a pen. Supervisor
1 stated he found Staff 1 and Youth A engaged in a tussle on the
classroom ground. Supervisor 1 stated he did not recall the
positioning of Youth A and Staff 1 on the ground. Supervisor 1
6

stated he redirected Staff 1 to leave the classroom and directed
the youths in the classroom to stay back. Supervisor 1 stated he
was unable to recall Staff 1 and Youth A’s position on the
classroom ground but denied seeing Staff 1 choke Youth A.
Supervisor 1 stated he did not recall how Youth A was transported
to his room, but believes it was a two-person escort. Supervisor 1
stated Youth A grabbed Staff 1 and refused to let go and tussled
with Staff 1 in his room. Supervisor 1 stated Supervisor Trainee
redirected Youth A to calm down and asked him what was going
on. Supervisor 1 stated he directed Staff 1 to leave the room
because Youth A was yelling and crying and focused on him.
Supervisor 1 stated he, Staff 1, and Supervisor Trainee left Youth
A’s room and closed the door. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A
banged his head on his room door window and then tried to choke
himself with a shirt. Supervisor 1 stated he called for Therapist.
Supervisor 1 stated Supervisor Trainee opened Youth A’s room
door to get the shirt from Youth A and Youth A began to scream
and kick. Supervisor 1 stated he and Staff 1 stood by Youth A’s
room door until Youth A’s shirt was retrieved and then closed the
room door. Supervisor 1 stated he and Supervisor Trainee left the
unit and later returned for an assistance call with Supervisor
Trainee, DRL and DO because Youth A flooded his room.
Supervisor 1 stated DRL obtained handcuffs and ankle shackles
and DRL and Supervisor Trainee placed the mechanical restraints
on Youth A. Supervisor 1 stated Nurse was called because Youth
A has asthma and was hyperventilating. Supervisor 1 stated DRL
directed Youth A be moved to room 9 but does not recall who
escorted Youth A. Supervisor 1 stated he debriefed Staff 1 and
Staff 2 and left the unit. Supervisor 1 stated Staff 1 handled Youth
A “roughly” and he redirected Staff 1 not to hurt Youth A.
Supervisor 1 stated Staff 1’s actions were not malicious or
abusive. Supervisor 1 denied witnessing Staff 1 place Youth A in a
chokehold or Youth A losing consciousness in the classroom or
twisting Youth A’s arm behind his back in the classroom or in
room 2.
Supervisor Trainee was interviewed on 10/16/2024 with his
Union Representative 2 and another DHHS worker. Supervisor
Trainee stated he responded to an assistance call on Unit 3D and
found Youth A in the classroom with Staff 1 and Supervisor 1 and
expressed self-harm with a pencil or pen. Supervisor Trainee
stated he asked, “What are we doing?” and was told that Youth A
would be transported to his room. Supervisor Trainee stated he
and Staff 1 escorted Youth A to his room. Supervisor Trainee
stated he did not recall the details of the escort but recalls Youth A
did not go willingly. Supervisor Trainee stated Staff 1 opened
7

Youth A’s room door when Youth A put a shirt around his neck in
his room, retrieved the shirt and exited. Supervisor Trainee stated
he did not recall Staff 1 or Supervisor 1’s actions in the retrieval of
Youth A’s shirt. Supervisor Trainee stated he is unaware of Youth
A being physically managed in the retrieval of the shirt. Supervisor
Trainee stated Therapist was called to assist with Youth A.
Supervisor Trainee stated he returned to Unit 3D when Youth A
flooded his room. Supervisor Trainee stated he entered Youth A’s
room with Staff 1, Supervisor 1, and DRL. Supervisor Trainee
stated DRL directed Youth A be placed in handcuffs and ankle
shackles and transported to room 9. Supervisor Trainee stated he
assisted in transporting Youth A to room 9. Supervisor Trainee
denied witnessing Youth A lose consciousness in the classroom
or Youth A’s arm twisted behind his back or being straddled by
staff in the classroom or in room 2.
Director of Residential Life was interviewed on 10/16/2024 at
Wayne County Juvenile Detention with another DHHS worker.
DRL stated he responded to an assistance call on Unit 3D when
Youth A flooded his room and was physically managed for
aggression. DRL stated he retrieved and placed the mechanical
restraints on Youth A before Youth A was transported from room 2
to room 9. DRL stated he left Unit 3D once Youth A was placed in
room 9.
Director of Operations was interviewed on 10/16/2024 at Wayne
County Juvenile Detention with another DHHS worker. DO stated
she responded to a crisis on Unit 3D. DO stated she found Youth
A in his flooded room with blankets on the ground absorbing the
water. DO stated Youth A wanted to fight Staff 1, Supervisor 1 and
Supervisor Trainee as DRL tried verbally redirecting Youth A. DO
stated Youth A was physically managed by Staff 1, Supervisor 1
and Supervisor Trainee. DO stated she called for Therapist and
Nurse. DO stated Staff 1, Supervisor 1 and Supervisor Trainee
transported Youth A to room 9 because it was dry. DO stated she
redirected the other youths on the unit and was not present when
handcuffs and ankle shackles were placed on Youth A. DO stated
she left the unit after Youth A was moved to room 9 and Therapist
arrived on the unit to support Youth A.
Therapist was interviewed on 10/30/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with her student intern and another DHHS
worker. Therapist stated she was called to Unit 3D to meet with
Youth A. Therapist stated Youth A was physically managed in
room 2 by Staff 1 and possibly Supervisor Trainee. Therapist
stated Supervisor 1 and DRL were also present, but not involved
8

in physically managing Youth A. Therapist stated Youth A said,
“You’re hurting my leg” and she directed staff to relieve pressure
on Youth A’s leg, however, she did not observe anyone holding
Youth A’s leg. Therapist stated Youth A tried to exit his room and
was held back by staff. Therapist stated when Youth A was in his
room by himself with the door closed, he beat on his chest, pulled
his hair and banged on the floor. Therapist stated she redirected
Youth A to calm down and that she would return to speak with him
when he was ready. Therapist stated Youth A said, “You won’t.
Everyone hates me.” Therapist stated she returned to Unit 3D and
learned that Youth A flooded his room. Therapist stated Youth A
was transported to room 9 in handcuffs and ankle shackles but
does not recall who transported him. Therapist stated Youth A
cried and screamed in room 9 and tried to maneuver his handcuffs
from behind his back to the front. Therapist stated Youth A
banged his head against the wall causing the right side of his
forehead by the hairline to bleed. Therapist stated a nurse was
called to assess Youth A.
Video
09/30/2024 Unit 3D video at 9:23 AM shows Youth A standing
with his back to a classroom wall and Staff 1 standing in front of
Youth A. Staff 1 reaches towards Youth A’s arm and then wraps
his arms around Youth A’s back and under his arms with Youth A
bent forward at the waist and they tussle to the ground. On the
ground, Staff 1 wraps one arm with his elbow in front of Youth A’s
neck. Staff 2 walks into the classroom and tries to assist. Staff 1
and Youth A are on the ground and Staff 1 lays partially on top of
Youth A’s chest area. Youths in the classroom watch Youth A and
Staff 1. Supervisor 1 enters the classroom. Staff 1 positions Youth
A in a standing position against the wall. Supervisor 1 stands to
the side and holds Youth A’s right arm. Youth A goes to the
ground on his knees and then gets up. Supervisor Trainee enters
the classroom. At 9:27 AM Youth A is escorted in a carried and
dragged manner with Supervisor 1 and Supervisor Trainee
securing Youth A’s arms and Staff 1 securing Youth A’s legs
(Youth A is facing upward) from the classroom to room 2. Youth A
struggles in the transport and Supervisor 1 and Supervisor
Trainee release their hold of Youth A in the common area. Staff 1
and Youth A tussle on the ground. Supervisor Trainee taps Staff 1
on his back repeatedly before Staff 1 pulls and drags Youth A by
his ankles into room 2 with Supervisor Trainee trying to hold Youth
A’s arm. Youth A is on the ground in his room kicking at Staff 1
and Supervisor Trainee. Supervisor 1 enters the room and Youth
A is placed on the bed. Staff 1 steps out of the room. Supervisor
Trainee and Supervisor 1 are entwined with Youth A. Supervisor 1
9

pulls off Youth A’s pants in the process of holding Youth A’s legs.
Supervisor 1 steps out of the room. Supervisor Trainee pulls
Youth A’s arms, then picks up Youth A and places him on the bed
and tries to exit. Youth A gets up from the bed and tries to exit.
Supervisor Trainee and Supervisor 1 push and move Youth A into
the room. Supervisor 1 steps out of the room. Supervisor Trainee
pulls Youth A’s arm and then picks up Youth A, places him on the
bed and runs out of the room. Staff 1 closes the door. Youth A
bangs his head against the room door window and tries to rip his
mattress. At 10:31 AM Youth A covers his room door window with
paper. Staff 1 enters room 2, takes down the paper and holds
Youth A from behind until he picks Youth A up and places him on
to the bed. Staff 2 is seen taking things out of Youth A’s room.
Supervisor Trainee enters the room and assists Staff 1 with Youth
A. DRL arrives and pulls Staff 1’s arm to leave the room. Staff 1
exits the room. Supervisor Trainee tussles with Youth A and
places Youth A on the bed. DRL is not present when Staff 1
enters the room to assist Supervisor Trainee. Supervisor 1 pulls
Supervisor Trainee out of the room. Staff 2 mops up the water
from the room. At 10:43 AM DRL returns and Youth A is placed in
handcuffs and ankle shackles on his bed. At 10:46 AM Youth A
walks from room 2 to room 9 in a two-person escort by Staff 1 and
Supervisor Trainee.
Documentation
Unit 3D’s 09/30/2024 logbook entries were reviewed. Summary of
logbook documentation relevant to this allegation is listed below.
• 9:30 AM Staff 1 wrote: Youth A threatened to stab a youth
with a pen. Pen was retrieved. Supervisor 1 and Supervisor
Trainee responded to the assistance call. Youth A was
escorted to his room. Primary Restraint Technique was
used. Youth A ripped his clothes in his room.
• 10:27 AM Staff 2 wrote: Youth A covered his room door
window with paper.
• 10:56 AM Staff 2 wrote: Assistance called.
• 11:07 AM Staff 2 wrote: Therapist met with Youth A.
Staff 1 wrote an incident report that predominantly matches his
interview. Staff 1 wrote he used a primary restraint technique hold
in the classroom with Youth A. Staff 1 did not mark the prompt on
the incident report that physical management occurred in the
classroom or in room 2. Seclusion was also not marked on the
incident report.
Supervisor Trainee wrote two incident reports that relate to his
interview. Supervisor Trainee did not mark the prompt on the
10

incident report that Youth A was restrained in the classroom.
Supervisor Trainee marked the prompt on the incident report that
Youth A was restrained in room 2. Supervisor Trainee did not
mark the prompt on the incident report that Youth A was secluded
in room 2 and room 9.
Staff 2 stated she did not write an incident report because after
the incident she went to court with a youth and forgot to write one
upon return.
An incident report written by Supervisor 1, DRL and DO were not
received from Wayne County Juvenile Detention Center.
Youth A’s Nursing Progress Note dated 09/30/2024 states Youth
A complained of pain in right hand after physical management by
staff. Youth A was able to move extremities. Youth A was given
ibuprofen.
Youth A’s Nursing Progress Note dated 09/30/2024 states Youth
A sat on his bed and appeared alert and oriented as he met with
Therapist. Youth A was not observed with blood on the front, right
side of his head. Nurse did not enter Youth A’s room but
evaluated from the room door due to his aggressive behavior.
Youth A denied pain.
Staff 1 had Handle with Care training on 10/30/2023 and
01/25/2024. Staff 1 does not have a discipline history.
Supervisor Trainee had Handle with Care training on 04/24/2024.
Supervisor Trainee does not have a discipline history.
Supervisor 1 had Handle with Care training on 09/07/2023 and
01/26/2024. Supervisor 1 does not have a discipline history.
Staff 1, Supervisor 1 and Supervisor Trainee have been taken off
the schedule pending investigation per Deputy Director.
Unit 3D
Unit 3D has two entrance and exit doors. Upon entering the unit, a
classroom is located between the two entrance and exit doors. A
sink counter adjoins the front classroom wall, and a staff desk
runs parallel in front of the sink counter. Across from the staff desk
is the unit gym. The unit has two shower stalls located in the far-
right corner on the same wall as the entrance and exit doors upon
entering the unit. Youth rooms surround the common area of the
unit to the right and left of the staff desk. Room 2 is to the far left
11

upon entering the unit. Room 9 is to the right of the gym upon
entering the unit.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance when Staff 1 attempted to
pull a pen from Youth A’s hand, wraps his arms around Youth A,
pushes Youth A to the ground, tussles with Youth A and wraps
one arm with his elbow in front of Youth A’s neck (chokehold) on
the classroom ground before standing Youth A up and holding him
against a wall. Noncompliance is also found in Youth A’s transport
from the classroom to his room. Youth A was carried, pulled and
dragged to his room by Staff 1, Supervisor 1 and Supervisor
Trainee. Noncompliance is also found when Youth A is pushed
and pulled in his room by Staff 1, Supervisor 1 and Supervisor
Trainee.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Teachers are trained in Handle with Care and should be available
and ready to assist if requested and needed.
Staff is to call for assistance before engaging in a physical manner
with a youth.
CONSULTATION
Unit 3D youths in the classroom should have been directed and
followed direction to move to the other side of the classroom or to
move into the common area to allow staff to work with Youth A
without an audience and decrease potential safety issues.
Video review captured Youth A’s room door being forcefully
closed to prevent him from exiting. This action is potentially
hazardous for possible injury.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
2024SIC0001771 Corrective action plan pending
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection and supervision of residents.
12

Allegation Additional Finding
Investigation Interviews
Youth A was interviewed on 10/10/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention Center with another DHHS worker. Youth A
stated Unit 3D room 9 door lock was stuffed the day before and
this allowed Youth E to manipulate the room door open, enter with
Youth C and assault him on 09/30/2024 during afternoon shift.
Youth A stated Staff 3 entered room 9 and separated Youth A
from Youth C and Youth E. Youth A stated he went to the hospital
and received stitches for the cut he obtained on his left upper lip.
Youth A stated he was transferred to Unit 1C when he returned

Wayne County Juvenile Detention Facility is required to submit an
incident report.”
Additional Finding 2
Interviews
Staff 1, Supervisor 1 and Supervisor Trainee were separately
interviewed on 10/16/2024 at Wayne County Juvenile Detention
Center with their respective Union Representative and another
DHHS Worker. Each stated Youth A had a shirt around his neck.
Staff 1 stated the shirt was ripped. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A
tried to choke himself with the shirt.
Documentation
Wayne County Juvenile Detention does not have seclusion
documentation for Youth A being placed on close observation,
suicide precaution or suicide watch per Deputy Director email
response dated 11/12/2024.
Wayne County Juvenile Detention’s Suicide Prevention 17.25
policy and procedure defines suicide gesture as “Any intentional
self-injurious behavior on the part of the resident that is not life
28

threatening.” Close watch is defined as “Visual observation of the
resident with frequent intervals not to exceed fifteen (15) minutes.”
The policy states a youth is placed on close watch “when they are
having suicidal or self-harming thoughts, has a recent prior history
of suicidal/self- mutilating [sic] behavior is posing a serious threat
to others but has no active plan to hurt self/others.” It states a
supervisor may place a youth on close watch if medical and
mental health staff are not available. It states staff will observe the
youth at staggered intervals not to exceed five (5) minutes, which
is documented on the behavioral management sheet.
Analysis Additional Finding 1
The agency is found in non-compliance of their policy and
procedure when Staff 2, Supervisor 1, DRL, DO and Therapist did
not write an incident report about their involvement with Youth A
on 09/30/2024.
Additional Finding 2
The agency is found in noncompliance for not assessing Youth
A’s suicide gesture when he placed a ripped shirt around his neck
to choke himself.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Wayne County Juvenile Detention’s Suicide Prevention policy and
procedure definition and procedure for close watch are
contradictory. The definition states visual observation is required
within 15 minutes and the procedure states it is within five
minutes. The time requirement needs to be the same and
appropriate for the level of supervision needed.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
